alert.note: Alert for Northeast Suffolk; Northern Nassau; Northwest Suffolk (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued January 29 at 4:31PM EST until January 30 at 12:00AM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Around one foot of inundation above ground level expected in vulnerable north shore communities of the twin forks of LI, north shore of LI near the waterfront and shoreline. * WHERE...Northwest Suffolk, Northeast Suffolk, and Northern Nassau Counties. * WHEN...Until midnight EST tonight. * COASTAL IMPACTS...Minor flooding is expected in the most vulnerable locations near the waterfront and shoreline. Expect around 1 foot of inundation above ground level in low lying, vulnerable areas. A few to several roads and low lying property including parking lots, parks, lawns and homes/businesses with basements near the waterfront will experience shallow flooding. A few cars may take on water and be damaged if not moved. * SHORELINE IMPACTS...3 to 5 ft surf likely for north shore of LI with Sat PM tides, which will likely cause beach erosion and possibly minor damage to shoreline structures. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. FLAX POND AT OLD FIELD NY MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 9.2 FT, MODERATE 10.2 FT, MAJOR 12.2 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.9 FT, MODERATE 2.9 FT, MAJOR 4.9 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 29/09 PM 8.6/ 9.1 1.3/ 1.8 2.2/ 2.7 3-4 NONE 30/09 AM 8.5/ 9.0 1.2/ 1.7 0.9/ 1.4 3 NONE 30/09 PM 5.1/ 5.6 -2.2/-1.8 -1.1/-0.7 1 NONE 31/09 AM 7.3/ 7.8 0.0/ 0.5 0.4/ 0.9 1 NONE 31/10 PM 6.8/ 7.3 -0.6/-0.1 0.2/ 0.8 1 NONE PECONIC RIVER AT RIVERHEAD NY MLLW CATEGORIES - info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
